title: How to Prepare Sashimi Using Crab and Sea Bream

steps.headline: Allow yourself to purchase fish sashimi from a fish specialist.
steps.description: You'll want to get moist, shiny, and bright skin and firm flesh.

steps.headline: Have the specialist prepare the sashimi in fillets.
Prepare the crab leg.
steps.description: Carefully snap and crack the crab's leg to get the meat. Just be sure not to damage the meat. Use pliers to remove it from the bones.

steps.headline: Cut the crab into bite size portions.
Prepare the sea bream.
steps.description: Lay the fillet on the cutting board. Take your knife and carefully slice between the skin and flesh. Use your free hand to hold the fish in place - so that it doesn't move with the cuts.

steps.headline: Shape the fillets into rectangles.
steps.description: You'll want even portions of sashimi. Cut off large thin slices from the fillet. Fold each piece over as you go. Use only one knife motion across the fish fillets.

steps.headline: Make a small ball from a handful of daikon.
steps.description: Place it on the serving plate.

steps.headline: Place one shiso leaf on the daikon ball.
Nest the crab and sea bream on the top.
Add a very small ball of wasabi on the side.
steps.description: Wasabi is an extremely hot mustard paste and should be optional for use.

text: Allow yourself to purchase fish sashimi from a fish specialist. You'll want to get moist, shiny, and bright skin and firm flesh. Have the specialist prepare the sashimi in fillets.  Prepare the crab leg. Carefully snap and crack the crab's leg to get the meat. Just be sure not to damage the meat. Use pliers to remove it from the bones. Cut the crab into bite size portions.  Prepare the sea bream. Lay the fillet on the cutting board. Take your knife and carefully slice between the skin and flesh. Use your free hand to hold the fish in place - so that it doesn't move with the cuts. Shape the fillets into rectangles. You'll want even portions of sashimi. Cut off large thin slices from the fillet. Fold each piece over as you go. Use only one knife motion across the fish fillets. Make a small ball from a handful of daikon. Place it on the serving plate. Place one shiso leaf on the daikon ball.  Nest the crab and sea bream on the top.  Add a very small ball of wasabi on the side. Wasabi is an extremely hot mustard paste and should be optional for use.
